verses.verse: At <WG1722> that <WG1565> time <WG2540> Yeshuw`a <WG2424> went <WG4198> <WG5675> on the sabbath day <WG4521> through <WG1223> the corn <WG4702>; and <WG1161> his <WG846> Talmidim <WG3101> were an hungred <WG3983> <WG5656>, and <WG2532> began <WG756> <WG5662> to pluck <WG5089> <WG5721> the ears of corn <WG4719>, and <WG2532> to eat <WG2068> <WG5721>.

But <WG1161> when the P'rushim <WG5330> saw <WG1492> <WG5631> it, they said <WG2036> <WG5627> unto him <WG846>, Behold <WG2400> <WG5628>, thy <WG4675> Talmidim <WG3101> do <WG4160> <WG5719> that which <WG3739> is <WG1832> not <WG3756> Torahful <WG1832> <WG5748> to do <WG4160> <WG5721> upon <WG1722> the sabbath day <WG4521>.

But <WG1161> he said <WG2036> <WG5627> unto them <WG846>, Have ye <WG314> not <WG3756> read <WG314> <WG5627> what <WG5101> David <WG1138> did <WG4160> <WG5656>, when <WG3753> he <WG846> was an hungred <WG3983> <WG5656>, and <WG2532> they <WG3326> that were with him <WG846>;

How <WG4459> he entered into <WG1525> <WG5627> <WG1519> the house <WG3624> of 'Elohim <WG2316>, and <WG2532> did eat <WG5315> <WG5627> the shewbread <WG740> <WG4286>, which <WG3739> was <WG2258> <WG5713> not <WG3756> Torahful <WG1832> <WG5752> for him <WG846> to eat <WG5315> <WG5629>, neither for <WG3761> them which <WG3326> were with him <WG846>, but <WG1508> only <WG3441> for the Kohanim <WG2409>?

Or <WG2228> have ye <WG314> not <WG3756> read <WG314> <WG5627> in <WG1722> the Torah <WG3551>, how that <WG3754> on the sabbath days <WG4521> the Kohanim <WG2409> in <WG1722> the temple <WG2411> profane <WG953> <WG5719> the sabbath <WG4521>, and <WG2532> are <WG1526> <WG5748> blameless <WG338>?
But <WG1161> I say <WG3004> <WG5719> unto you <WG5213>, That <WG3754> in this place <WG5602> is one <WG2076> <WG5748> greater than <WG3187> the temple <WG2411>.

But <WG1161> if <WG1487> ye had known <WG1097> <WG5715> what <WG5101> this meaneth <WG2076> <WG5748>, I will have <WG2309> <WG5719> mercy <WG1656>, and <WG2532> not <WG3756> sacrifice <WG2378>, ye would <WG302> not <WG3756> have condemned <WG2613> <WG5656> the guiltless <WG338>.
For <WG1063> the Son <WG5207> of man <WG444> is <WG2076> <WG5748> YY <WG2962> even <WG2532> of the sabbath day <WG4521>.
And <WG2532> when he was departed <WG3327> <WG5631> thence <WG1564>, he went <WG2064> <WG5627> into <WG1519> their <WG846> synagogue <WG4864>:

And <WG2532>, behold <WG2400> <WG5628>, there was <WG2258> <WG5713> a man <WG444> which had <WG2192> <WG5723> his hand <WG5495> withered <WG3584>. And <WG2532> they asked <WG1905> <WG5656> him <WG846>, saying <WG3004> <WG5723>, Is it Torahful <WG1487> <WG1832> <WG5748> to heal <WG2323> <WG5721> on the sabbath days <WG4521>? that <WG2443> they might accuse <WG2723> <WG5661> him <WG846>.

How much <WG4214> then <WG3767> is a man <WG444> better than <WG1308> <WG5719> a sheep <WG4263>? Wherefore <WG5620> it is Torahful <WG1832> <WG5748> to do <WG4160> <WG5721> well <WG2573> on the sabbath days <WG4521>.

Then <WG5119> saith <WG3004> <WG5719> he to the man <WG444>, Stretch forth <WG1614> <WG5657> thine <WG4675> hand <WG5495>. And <WG2532> he stretched it forth <WG1614> <WG5656>; and <WG2532> it was restored <WG600> <WG5681> whole <WG5199>, like as <WG5613> the other <WG243>.

Then <WG1161> the P'rushim <WG5330> went out <WG1831> <WG5631>, and held <WG2983> <WG5627> a council <WG4824> against <WG2596> him <WG846>, how <WG3704> they might destroy <WG622> <WG5661> him <WG846>.

But <WG1161> when Yeshuw`a <WG2424> knew <WG1097> <WG5631> it, he withdrew himself <WG402> <WG5656> from thence <WG1564>: and <WG2532> great <WG4183> multitudes <WG3793> followed <WG190> <WG5656> him <WG846>, and <WG2532> he healed <WG2323> <WG5656> them <WG846> all <WG3956>;
And <WG2532> charged <WG2008> <WG5656> them <WG846> that <WG3363> they should <WG4160> not <WG3363> make <WG4160> <WG5661> him <WG846> known <WG5318>:
That <WG3704> it might be fulfilled <WG4137> <WG5686> which <WG3588> was spoken <WG4483> <WG5685> by <WG1223> Esaias <WG2268> the prophet <WG4396>, saying <WG3004> <WG5723>,

And <WG2532> in <WG1722> his <WG846> name <WG3686> shall <WG1679> the goyim <WG1484> trust <WG1679> <WG5692>.

Then <WG5119> was brought <WG4374> <WG5681> unto him <WG846> one possessed with a devil <WG1139> <WG5740>, blind <WG5185>, and <WG2532> dumb <WG2974>: and <WG2532> he healed <WG2323> <WG5656> him <WG846>, insomuch that <WG5620> the blind <WG5185> and <WG2532> dumb <WG2974> both <WG2532> spake <WG2980> <WG5721> and <WG2532> saw <WG991> <WG5721>.

But <WG1161> when the P'rushim <WG5330> heard <WG191> <WG5660> it, they said <WG2036> <WG5627>, This <WG3778> fellow doth <WG1544> not <WG3756> cast out <WG1544> <WG5719> devils <WG1140>, but <WG1508> by <WG1722> Beelzebub <WG954> the prince <WG758> of the devils <WG1140>.

And <WG2532> if <WG1487> Satan <WG4567> cast out <WG1544> <WG5719> Satan <WG4567>, he is divided <WG3307> <WG5681> against <WG1909> himself <WG1438>; how <WG4459> shall <WG2476> then <WG3767> his <WG846> kingdom <WG932> stand <WG2476> <WG5701>?

Either <WG2228> make <WG4160> <WG5657> the tree <WG1186> good <WG2570>, and <WG2532> his <WG846> fruit <WG2590> good <WG2570>; or else <WG2228> make <WG4160> <WG5657> the tree <WG1186> corrupt <WG4550>, and <WG2532> his <WG846> fruit <WG2590> corrupt <WG4550>: for <WG1063> the tree <WG1186> is known <WG1097> <WG5743> by <WG1537> his fruit <WG2590>.

A good <WG18> man <WG444> out of <WG1537> the good <WG18> treasure <WG2344> of the heart <WG2588> bringeth forth <WG1544> <WG5719> good things <WG18>: and <WG2532> an evil <WG4190> man <WG444> out of <WG1537> the evil <WG4190> treasure <WG2344> bringeth forth <WG1544> <WG5719> evil things <WG4190>.

For <WG1063> by <WG1537> thy <WG4675> words <WG3056> thou shalt be justified <WG1344> <WG5701>, and <WG2532> by <WG1537> thy <WG4675> words <WG3056> thou shalt be condemned <WG2613> <WG5701>.

Then <WG5119> certain <WG5100> of the scribes <WG1122> and <WG2532> of the P'rushim <WG5330> answered <WG611> <WG5662>, saying <WG3004> <WG5723>, Master <WG1320>, we would <WG2309> <WG5719> see <WG1492> <WG5629> a sign <WG4592> from <WG575> thee <WG4675>.

For <WG1063> as <WG5618> Jonas <WG2495> was <WG2258> <WG5713> three <WG5140> days <WG2250> and <WG2532> three <WG5140> nights <WG3571> in <WG1722> the whale's <WG2785> belly <WG2836>; so <WG3779> shall the Son <WG5207> of man <WG444> be <WG2071> <WG5704> three <WG5140> days <WG2250> and <WG2532> three <WG5140> nights <WG3571> in <WG1722> the heart <WG2588> of the earth <WG1093>.

<WG1161> When <WG3752> the unclean <WG169> spirit <WG4151> is gone <WG1831> <WG5632> out of <WG575> a man <WG444>, he walketh <WG1330> <WG5736> through <WG1223> dry <WG504> places <WG5117>, seeking <WG2212> <WG5723> rest <WG372>, and <WG2532> findeth <WG2147> <WG5719> none <WG3756>.

Then <WG5119> he saith <WG3004> <WG5719>, I will return <WG1994> <WG5692> into <WG1519> my <WG3450> house <WG3624> from whence <WG3606> I came out <WG1831> <WG5627>; and <WG2532> when he is come <WG2064> <WG5631>, he findeth <WG2147> <WG5719> it empty <WG4980> <WG5723>, swept <WG4563> <WG5772>, and <WG2532> garnished <WG2885> <WG5772>.

While <WG2089> he <WG846> yet <WG1161> talked <WG2980> <WG5723> to the people <WG3793>, behold <WG2400> <WG5628>, his mother <WG3384> and <WG2532> his <WG846> brethren <WG80> stood <WG2476> <WG5715> without <WG1854>, desiring <WG2212> <WG5723> to speak <WG2980> <WG5658> with him <WG846>.

And <WG2532> he stretched forth <WG1614> <WG5660> his <WG846> hand <WG5495> toward <WG1909> his <WG846> Talmidim <WG3101>, and said <WG2036> <WG5627>, Behold <WG2400> <WG5628> my <WG3450> mother <WG3384> and <WG2532> my <WG3450> brethren <WG80>!
